articles.title: National Meeting Marks 60th Anniversary of Victory in Fatherland Liberation War
articles.content:
National Meeting Marks 60th Anniversary of Victory in Fatherland Liberation War
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- A grand national meeting was held at May Day Stadium Friday to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, appeared at the tribune of honor of the meeting place.
					
					 Taking the tribune of honor were senior officials of the party, the state and the army including Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party, and officials of the party and armed forces organs.
					
					 Seen there were Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-president of the People's Republic of China, Abdullah al-Ahmar, deputy general secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party, Guy Scott, vice-president of the Republic of Zambia, Edward Kiwanuka Ssekand, vice-president of the Republic of Uganda, and heads of foreign delegations.
					
					 Also seen there were Hong In Hum, chairman of the Central Audit Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, Choe Un Bok, chairperson of the General Association of Koreans in China, and Kim Kang Hui, head of the lecturers group of veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers. 
					
					 Present at the meeting were delegates of war veterans, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, social organizations, ministries and national institutions, bereaved families of fallen fighters, service personnel of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials in the fields of science, education, art and literature, public health and media, merited persons, Pyongyangites, delegations of overseas compatriots, compatriots abroad and chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 Present on invitation there were diplomatic envoys of various countries, representatives of international organizations and members of the military attaches corps here, delegations and delegates of various countries staying here to participate in events to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war and other foreign guests.
					
					 KPA Vice Marshal Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, declared the meeting open.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, made a report at the meeting.
					
					 He said:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists ignited the Korean war on June 25, 1950 to realize their wild ambition to dominate Asia and the rest of the world with the Korean Peninsula as its springboard. They hurled into the war even troops of its satellite countries by abusing the UN flag, and applied all sorts of the most brutal war methods and means including the threat of A-bombs.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK defeated the invaders of 16 countries including the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces in the war.
					
					 The historic victory in the war was the victory of the Juche-oriented military idea and outstanding strategy and tactics of President Kim Il Sung and one of the indomitable mental power of the army and people of the DPRK as they heroically fought, united close around the party and the leader.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists sustained a heavy defeat for the first time in their more than 100-year-long history of wars of aggression in the three-year-long Korean war and signed an instrument of surrender.  
					
					 The DPRK, which beat back U.S. imperialism, was widely known as a country of heroes and its army and people earned worldwide fame as a heroic army and people.
					
					 During the war the party and government of China sent volunteers organized by its fine sons and daughters under the banner of resisting America and aiding Korea, safeguarding the home and defending the motherland even under the difficult situation where they just won victory in the people's revolution. They helped the Korean people in their just struggle at the cost of blood.
					
					 The internationalist example set by the Chinese People's Volunteers in the war recorded a shining page in the history of the DPRK-China friendship and the Korean party and people will always remember this.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK greeted a new era of history   in which they are successfully carrying forward the history and tradition of sure victory which started in Mt. Paektu and reliably steering the human cause of independence, thanks to Kim Jong Un, the reporter noted, and went on:
					
					 We should hold the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal leaders of our party and people and the sun of Juche for all ages and firmly uphold and eternally glorify the undying feats Kim Il Sung performed by winning a victory in the war and the Songun revolutionary feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will continue dynamically advancing for peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula, Northeast Asia and the rest of the world together with the progressive people who aspire after justice and value conscience.
					
					 Only July 27 of victory will be in store for the DPRK as the undying feats Kim Il Sung performed by winning the victory in the war and the Songun revolutionary exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are shedding their rays and there are the invincible Paektusan army and the great unity of the army and people wisely led by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Similar meetings took place in provinces, cities (districts), counties and industrial complexes to mark the anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Grand Gymnastic, Artistic Performance "Arirang"
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Grand Gymnastic, Artistic Performance "Arirang"
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un enjoyed grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", Kim Il Sung Prize winner, on Friday on the occasion of the anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 When Kim Jong Un appeared at the tribune of honor of May Day Stadium, the audience and performers broke into cheers of "hurrah!" shaking the stadium and it presented spectacular scenery with varieties of rhythmic effects, lightings and the nocturnal sky was decorated with gorgeous fireworks.
					
					 Among the audience were seniors officials of the party, state and army including Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and Choe Ryong Hae, the chairperson of a friendly party, war veteran delegates, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, bereaved families of martyrs, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, merited persons and Pyongyangites.
					
					 Delegations of overseas Koreans and other overseas compatriots and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front were also among the audience. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were the delegations and delegates of various countries staying in the DPRK to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international bodies and members of the  military attaches corps here and other foreign guests. 
					
					 The extravaganza "Arirang" began with the solemn playing of the song "Arirang."
					
					 It made a grandiose epic representation of the 100-year-long history of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Korea in which its people put an end to the distress-torn history of the nation and put the sovereignty and dignity of the country on the highest level thanks to the outstanding leaders and peerless Songun commanders as well as  the immensely prosperous era of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the exploits Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, an invincible and iron-willed commander, performed by accomplishing the historic cause of national liberation through long, bloody anti-Japanese battles and defeating the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world.
					
					 The audience was mesmerized by the scenes representing the career of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il characterized by forced marches for patriotic devotion through which he protected the sovereignty of the country and the nation and provided an eternal cornerstone for prosperity.
					
					 The performers represented the sky-high spirit of all service personnel and people dynamically pushing forward the building of a thriving nation at the "speed of Masik Pass," true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un, with beautiful rhythms, artistic rendition and dynamic gymnastics.
					
					 The performance fully reflected the unshakable will of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to eternally glorify the great history of the victory in the war by protecting the dignity of the great Paektusan nation and meeting the challenges of the enemies through a merciless retaliatory sacred war. 
					
					 The audience was deeply impressed by the chapter of friendship Arirang as it dealt with the exploits the great Generalissimos performed by recording shining pages in the history of DPRK-China and DPRK-Russia friendship and the will of the Korean people to boost solidarity with the world progressive people, guided by the idea of independence, peace and friendship.
					
					 When the performance was over, the audience and performers broke into rousing cheers of "hurrah!" again shaking the stadium and fireworks were displayed to present fantastic scenery.
					
					 Kim Jong Un waved back to the enthusiastic cheers of the performers and audience and congratulated the performers on their successful presentation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Meets Heads of Foreign Delegations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Meets Heads of Foreign Delegations
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, met heads of delegations of different countries staying in the DPRK to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War on Friday.
					 Among them were Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-president of the People's Republic of China;Abdullah al-Ahmar, deputy general secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party; Edward Kiwanuka Ssekand, vice-president of the Republic of Uganda; Guy Scott, vice-president of the Republic of Zambia; Marie-Madeleine Mienze, deputy general secretary the People's Party for the Reconstruction and Democracy of Democratic Congo; Manuel Francisco Tuta, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola; Paolo Romani, vice-president of the Senate Group from the Popular Liberty of Italy; Jose Ramon Balaguer, head of the International Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba; Tran Quoc Vuong, secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam; Cheuang Sombounkhan, secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party; Yu Zhenwu, former commander of the Air Force of the Chinese People's Liberation Army; Sayed Hamidreza Tabatabaei, deputy commander-in-chief of the Army of Iran; Luong Cong, deputy head of the General Political Department of the Vietnam People's Army; Ya. V. Kanov, vice-chairman of the Korean War Veterans' Council of Russia; Li Xiubao, deputy head of the Publicity Department of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army; Avirmed Battor, vice-minister of Defence of Mongolia; Agostinho Salvador Mondlane, vice-minister of Defense of Mozambique; Odongo Jeje, minister of state for the Ministry of Defense of Uganda. Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Kyok Sik, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Kyong Hui and Kim Ki Nam.
					
					 The guests warmly congratulated Kim Jong Un on the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war and wished him good health and greater successes in his work.
					
					 Kim Jong Un expressed thanks for this.
					
					 He welcomed the foreign guests on a visit to the DPRK to take part in the celebrations of the  anniversary and hoped that they would spend comfortable and joyful days here.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Syrian Party Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Syrian Delegation
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the visiting Syrian delegation which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday. The delegation is led by Abdullah al-Ahmar, deputy general secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party.

articles.title: Vice-President of Presidium of DPRK SPA Meets Former U.S. Attorney eneral
articles.content:
Vice-President of Presidium of DPRK SPA Meets Former U.S. Attorney General 
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA), Friday met and had a talk with Ramsey Clark, former U.S. attorney general, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: WPK Secretaries Meet Foreign Party Delegations, Delegates
articles.content:
WPK Secretaries Meet Foreign Party Delegations, Delegates
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), on Friday met and had conversations with visiting delegations and delegates of political parties of different countries.
					 Kim Ki Nam met with the delegation of the Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action), delegation of the Workers' World Party of the United States of America, delegation of the National Democratic Party of Mongolia and the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland).
					
					 Choe Thae Bok  met with the delegation of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, delegation of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, delegation of the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran, delegation of the Mongolian People's Party and the chairman of the Standing Committee of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party.

articles.title: Vice-Premier Meets Foreign Government Delegates
articles.content:
Vice-Premier Meets Foreign Government Delegates
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Kang Sok Ju, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, met and had conversations with government delegates of Cambodia, Nepal, Sudan, Malaysia and Pakistan at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday. They are taking part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Representative of Palestinian President
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Representative of Palestinian President, Foreign Diplomatic Envoys
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on Friday met and had a talk with Jamal A. H. Al Muhisin, representative of the president of the State of Palestine, who came here to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Pak Ui Chun also met and had conversations with diplomatic envoys of Guinea, Namibia, Lesotho, Madagascar, Mozambique, Brunei, Azerbaijan, Eritrea and Mauritania.

articles.title: Minister of People's Armed Forces Meets Foreign Military Delegations
articles.content:
Minister of People's Armed Forces Meets Foreign Military Delegations
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Jang Jong Nam, minister of the People's Armed Forces, separately met and had conversations with the visiting Ugandan high-level military delegation, Mongolian government military delegation and Tanzanian military delegation on Friday.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Chinese Delegations
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Chinese Delegations
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received gifts from the delegation of war veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) and the delegation of war veterans and families of martyrs of the CPV.
					 The gifts were handed to Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, respectively by Yu Zhenwu, former commander of the Air Force of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and Yang Guoying, vice department director of the Ministry of Civil Affairs of China, who are heading the delegations, on Thursday.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Guests
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Foreign Guests
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received gifts from the visiting foreign guests.
					 A gift from the head and chief conductor of the Orchestra of the 21st Century of Russia and his party was handed to an official concerned by Head and Chief Conductor Pavel Borisovich Ovsyannikov on Thursday.
					
					 The general director and deputy general director of a Chinese company presented a gift to Kim Jong Un in their joint name on the same day.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian Personage
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian Personage
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 It was handed to DPRK Ambassador to Egypt Ri Hyok Chol by the vice-chairman on July 21.

articles.title: Ugandan Government Delegation Here
articles.content:
Ugandan Delegation Here 
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The Ugandan delegation led by Vice-President Edward Kiwanuka Ssekand arrived here by air on Friday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Lao Party, Government Delegation Here
articles.content:
Lao Party, Government Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the party and government of the Lao People's Democratic Republic headed by Cheuang Sombounkhan, secretary of the Central Committee and chairman of the Commission for Propaganda and Training Affairs of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, arrived here on Friday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Zambian Government Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Zambian Delegation Arrives
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The Zambian delegation led by Vice-President Guy Scott arrived here on Friday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Indonesian Government Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Indonesian Government Delegation Arrives
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- A government delegation of the Republic of Indonesia led by Meutia Farida Hatta Swasono, advisor of the Presidential Advisory Council, arrived here Friday to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Namibian Government Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Namibian Government Delegation Arrives
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- A Namibian government delegation led by Nambahu Thomas Tommy, vice-minister of Justice, arrived here on Friday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Indian Government Delegation Here
articles.content:
Indian Government Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- An Indian government delegation arrived here Friday to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.  
					 The delegation is led by Sitaram Yechury, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Transport, Tourism and Culture of the Parliament.

articles.title: Foreign Party Delegations, Delegates Here
articles.content:
Foreign Party Delegations, Delegates Here
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Party delegations and delegates from various countries arrived here on Friday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They included a delegation of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) led by Chairman of the Central Committee Harpal Brar, a delegation of deputies of the State Duma from A Just Russia led by Alexsandr Chetverikov, member of the Presidium of the Central Council, a delegation of the Italian Parliament led by Paolo Romani, vice-president of the Senate Group from the Popular Liberty, Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labor Party, and his party, and Ananskikh Igor, delegate of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia who is chairman of the Committee for Physical Culture and Sports and Youth Affairs of the State Duma of Russia.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Here
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Here
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Johnny Hon, co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, delegation of Iranian Majlis Friendship Group led by Musalreza Servati, chairman of the Planning and Budget Subcommittee of the Public Affairs Committee of Majlis, delegation of the Mongolian Agriculture, Food and Environment Workers' Trade Unions headed by President Ochirjantsan Gantuya arrived here on Friday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Arrive
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Arrive
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign delegations and guests arrived here on Thursday to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They included former Thai Foreign Minister Kantathi Suphamongkhon and his companion, delegation of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association headed by Chairman Mamoru Kitahara, Dimitris Palmyris, president of the World Federation of Democratic Youth, delegation of the Communist Youth Collectives of Spain headed by General Secretary Juan Nogueira Lopez, delegation of the Youth Federation of Mongolia headed by Chairman Munkhbat Ayush, delegation of the Global Partnership for the Prevention of Armed Conflict headed by Executive Director Peter Van Tuijl, delegation of the Institute for Strategic Studies of Mongolia headed by Gungaa Bazarvaani, delegation of the Heilongjiang People's Broadcasting Service of  China headed by Vice Department Director Zhao Hongyang, Valeri Zaretski, co-manager of the ISES Publishing House of Germany, and his companion, delegation of the Chinese film producers headed by Li Shuihe, vice-chairman of the China Film Producers Association,
					
					  and Kanji Inoki, president of the Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan and member of the House of Councillors of Japan, and his party.
					
					 Arriving here earlier were Ramsey Clark, former U.S. attorney general, and his party, delegation of the France-Korea Friendship Association headed by Vice-President Benoit Quennedey, delegation of the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences headed by Vice-Director Kulchin Iurii, delegation of the Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences headed by Vice-Director Ayubashev Boris, Wang Ruomin, director of a Chinese company and his companion, Chinese delegation of the Liaoning Provincial Association for International Friendly Contact headed by Assistant to the president Zhang Guixin and a delegation of Russian war veterans in the Amur Region headed by Yuri Shkurenkov.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Lays Wreath before Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Lays Wreath before Friendship Tower
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the People's Republic of China headed by Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-president of the PRC, laid a wreath before the Friendship Tower Friday. It is on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK to take part in the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Seen before the tower was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee who is vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA), Kim Yang Gon, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, officials concerned, Pyongyang citizens and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Wreaths were placed before the tower in the name of the delegation and in the joint name of the WPK Central Committee, the SPA Presidium and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Also laid there were the wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, Ministry of People's Security, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Foreign Trade, Ministry of Culture, Education Commission and Ministry of Railways, in the joint name of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association and in the joint name of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK and the Pyongyang City People's Committee.
					
					 Its participants observed moment's silence in memory of the fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) who bravely fought shoulder to shoulder with the Korean service personnel on the Korean front under the banner of resisting America and adding Korea, safeguarding the home and defending the motherland. They went round the tower.
					
					 On the same day, the delegation of war veterans of the CPV, the delegation of war veterans and families of martyrs of the CPV and the literary and art delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army also laid wreaths before the tower.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Lays Wreaths before Liberation Tower, Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of Soviet Army
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Lays Wreaths before Liberation Tower, Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of Soviet Army
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The delegation of Korean war veterans of Russia led by Ya. V. Kanov, vice-chairman of the Korean War Veterans' Council of Russia, laid a wreath before the Liberation Tower here on Friday.
					 The members of the delegation paid silent tribute to fallen fighters of the Soviet Army.
					
					 They also laid a wreath before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in Sadong District.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of CPV
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of CPV
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the People's Republic of China headed by Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-president of the PRC,  laid a wreath before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) in Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province on Friday.
					 Seen standing before the cemetery was a wreath sent by Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 Also seen standing there were wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the South Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK and the South Phyongan Provincial People's Committee, the Hoechang County Committee of the WPK and the Hoechang County People's Committee and a unit of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk, chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kim Song Nam, vice department  director of the C.C., WPK, Pyon In Son, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, officials concerned, officials of party and power organs in the province and the county, people in the county and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Wreaths were laid before the cemetery in the name of the delegation and in the joint name of the C.C., the WPK and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the martyrs of the CPV who bravely fought on the Korean front against the invasion by the imperialist allied forces.
					
					 They placed bouquets before the grave of Mao Anying before going round the cemetery.
					
					 In the meantime, the delegation visited the Songhung Revolutionary Site on the same day.
					
					 Li Yuanchao wrote in the visitor's book that the exploits of the CPV would shine forever.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Martyrs Cemeteries, Towers
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Martyrs Cemeteries, Towers
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong, Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery, Friendship Tower and the Liberation Tower on Friday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Laid on the wreath-laying stands of the martyrs cemeteries were wreaths sent by Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA) Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were senior party, state and army officials including Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and Choe Ryong Hae, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, social organizations, the Cabinet, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF) and other people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Placed on the wreath-laying stand of the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) and the Cabinet of the DPRK. Laid before the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery, the Friendship Tower and the Liberation Tower were wreaths in the joint name of the C.C., WPK, the Presidium of SPA and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Wreaths were placed in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, social organizations, ministries, national institutions, units of the KPA and the KPISF, institutions of science, education, public health and media and the party and power organs, factories, farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the martyrs.
					
					 They also paid respect to the martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers who fought on the Korean fronts against the aggression of the imperialist allied forces and to martyrs of the Soviet Army who fell in battles for the liberation of Korea.

articles.title: Foreign Military Delegations Pay Floral Tribute to War Martyrs
articles.content:
Foreign Military Delegations Pay Floral Tribute to War Martyrs
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign military delegations laid wreaths before the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery Friday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. Among them were the Ugandan high-level military delegation, the Mongolian government military delegation and other military delegations from Mozambique, Vietnam, Iran and Tanzania.
					 The delegations placed wreaths before the cemetery.
					
					 They observed a moment's silence in memory of the martyrs of the Korean People's Army who dedicated their lives to the sacred war against imperialism and the U.S. before looking round the cemetery.
					
					 On the same day, the delegation of Korean war veterans in Russia laid a wreath before the cemetery.

articles.title: Floral Basket Presented to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il from Russian Party
articles.content:
Floral Basket Presented to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il from Russian Party
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The Party for Peace and Unity of Russia sent a floral basket to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The floral basket was laid before the statues on Friday.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Pay Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Pay Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Overseas Koreans laid bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Friday and paid tribute to them.
					 They included overseas Korean war veterans, the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan and the delegation of the General Association of Koreans in China.

articles.title: Delegation of IIJI Secretariat Pays Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Delegation of IIJI Secretariat Pays Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Secretariat of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI) headed by Secretary General Kenichi Ogami visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Thursday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They laid floral baskets before the statues of the peerlessly great men in boundless reverence and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Russian Body
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Russian Body
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from the Committee for Economic Cooperation with Countries in Asia and Oceania of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of the Russian Federation.
					 It was handed to an official concerned Thursday by Vasili Usoltsev, chairman of the Committee who is heading the visiting delegation of the Chamber.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un from Japanese Delegation, Organization, Figures
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un from Japanese Delegation, Organization, Figures
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Japanese friendship and solidarity organizations, the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Fumihiro Himori who is leading the delegation of the above-said organizations and Kazutaka Yawata, representative of the Japan-Korea Society for Art and Cultural Interchange, sent floral baskets to the dear respected Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The floral baskets were separately conveyed to an official concerned by the head of the delegation and the representative of the society on Friday.

articles.title: War Veteran Delegates Visit War Martyrs Cemetery
articles.content:
War Veteran Delegates Visit War Martyrs Cemetery
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The war veteran delegates to the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War visited the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery on Friday.
					 They laid wreaths and bouquets at the wreath-laying stand "Soul of Heroes", recollecting their comrades-in-arms who bravely fought life-and-death battles against the enemy during the wartime, shouting long live the leader.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to martyrs who performed heroic feats in the battles against the U.S. imperialist aggressors under the leadership of the Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					 They went round the cemetery.
					
					 They made the rounds of a monument bearing President Kim Il Sung's proposition and a gatepost of a peculiar style, a monument to a poem dedicated to hero soldiers and group sculptures which were built around the Memorial Tower of the People's Army Martyrs.

articles.title: Foreign Party Delegations, Delegates Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Foreign Party Delegations, Delegates Visit Mangyongdae
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Party delegations and delegates of different countries visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. They included the delegation of the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist), delegation of the Communist Party in Sweden, delegation of the National Democratic Party of Mongolia, delegation of the Communist Party of Vietnam, delegation of the United Left Movement of Dominica, delegation of the Workers' Party of Mexico, delegation of the People's Party for the Reconstruction and Democracy of Democratic Congo, delegation of the Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action), delegation of the Workers' World Party of the United States of America, a member of the Central Committee of the Ukrainian Communist who doubles as second secretary of the Crimean Republic Committee and a secretary of the Sverdlovsk Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation.
					 The guests went round historic relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae with deep care, being briefed on the revolutionary career of the President and his family in Mangyongdae.
					
					 Michael Chant, general secretary of the C.C., the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) who is heading the delegation of the party, said President Kim Il Sung was born in a simple family. He continued: Kim Il Sung embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years and devoted his all to the struggle for the liberation and prosperity of the country. His family members were also ardent patriots who devoted their all to the revolution. 
					
					 Tran Quoc Vuong, secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam who is leading the delegation of the party, said Kim Il Sung dedicated his whole life to the happiness of the people.
					
					 Mangyongdae is playing an important role in educating the rising generation in revolution, he added.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Visit Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Visit Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests Friday visited the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Show for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Teguh Santosa, secretary general of the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange, said that the visit to the show made him keenly feel how deep the reverence of the Korean people and world progressives for the peerlessly great men is. Famous flowers will be in full bloom, he added.
					
					 Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, said that one can hardly find such spectacular show presented by beautiful flowers. 
					
					 Through the visit I came to know better about the personality of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il as great men, he noted.
					
					 The head of the delegation of the Turkey-DPRK Friendship Association said that beautiful flowers reflecting the reverence of all people for the peerlessly great men are on display.

articles.title: Photo Exhibitions Held in Provinces of DPRK
articles.content:
Photo Exhibitions Held in Provinces of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Photo exhibitions "July 27 of Victory" opened in every province of the DPRK to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Displayed in the exhibitions were photos of President Kim Il Sung, who defeated the U.S. imperialist aggressors by wisely leading the war, and those of the President and leader Kim Jong Il, who glorified the great history of the victory in the war. 
					
					 Among them were "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung reviewing the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War at the meeting of military and political cadres of combined units of the Korean People's Army and above", "The great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung and the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il giving field guidance to KPA unit".
					
					 There were also photos dealing with the personality of great leader Marshal Kim Jong Un as a great man.
					
					 On display were photos showing the army and people of the DPRK who displayed bravery in the war and the service personnel and people strengthening the military capabilities of the country and dynamically pushing forward the building of a thriving nation, remaining loyal to the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The exhibitions have drawn many people, including officials and schoolchildren.

articles.title: Glass-made Sculpture "Kim Jong Il's Birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp"
articles.content:
Glass-made Sculpture "Kim Jong Il's Birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp"
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- On display at the International Friendship Exhibition House is a glass-made sculpture "Kim Jong Il's birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp", which was presented as a gift to leader Kim Jong Il from V. F. Solinov, general manager of the Technical Glass Research Institute of Russia in Juche 86 (1997).
					 Solinov had already made it a routine job to present to Kim Jong Il a new product whenever his institute invented a new technology.
					
					 The gift represented his firm belief that the world would be surely guided by the Juche idea, created by President Kim Il Sung, as long as Kim Jong Il was creditably carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Korean People's Victory in War Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Korean People's Victory in War Celebrated Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Bangladesh, Romania and Iceland from July 19 to 21 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there were figures of all social strata and other people.
					
					 Speakers including Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, praised the Korean army and people's victory in the war as an event that instilled the great faith into the world independent forces and encouraged them to the struggle against imperialism, adding that the Koreans thwarted the aggression by the U.S., which boasted of being "the strongest" in the world, and achieved the brilliant victory under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They emphasized that the myth of the U.S. "mightiness" was shattered by the outstanding strategy, tactics and military methods of the President, adding the DPRK created a new myth.
					
					 Daniel Dediu, chairman of the Romanian Workers' Association, praised the President as a brilliant strategist and invincible and iron-willed commander who brought about the beginning of a downhill turn for the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 Jon Arni Halldorsson, general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society, disclosed that the U.S. imperialists mobilized huge military troops and war hardware and committed the whole gamut of brutal crimes.
					
					 He urged the U.S. to promptly respond to the DPRK's proposal for replacing the Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty.
					
					 Adopted at the meeting held in Romania was a congratulatory message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Korean People's Victory in War Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Korean People's Victory in War Praised by Foreign Newspapers
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of various countries dedicated special write-ups to the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The July 17th issue of the Iranian newspaper Iran News carried an article titled "60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War" illustrated with photos of President Kim Il Sung. It said as follows:
					
					 On July 27, 1953 the U.S. signed the Armistice Agreement which is as good as an official surrender document.
					
					 If the U.S. again inflicts a war on the DPRK, the latter will bring the historic end to the former.
					
					 The July 16th and 17th issues of the newspaper of the Democratic Congo La Prosperite allotted one whole page to photos of President Kim Il Sung and the dear respected Kim Jong Un under the block letter titled "Pyongyang celebrating the day of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War with joy" and articles titled "DPRK, an impregnable fortress", "Kim Jong Un, great successor to the cause of Juche" and others.
					
					 The July 17th issue of the Nepalese newspaper Nepal Today carried an article titled "60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the war" illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper in its article said that the U.S. imperialists suffered a great defeat in the past Fatherland Liberation War for the first time in history. Last December they viciously conducted anti-DPRK moves over its satellite launch.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats in War Praised by Kyrgyzstan Figure
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats in War Praised by Kyrgyzstan Figure
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgys El" Republican Political Party who is chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan, issued a statement on July 18 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 He in his statement said as follows:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung, great leader of the Korean people, was an invincible and iron-willed commander who won a brilliant victory in the severe war against U.S. imperialism.
					
					 When the U.S. imperialists ignited a war against the DPRK on June 25, 1950 with the ambition to dominate the world, the President declared an all-out war against the U.S., saying that the U.S. imperialists have taken the Korean people wrong.
					
					 The President aroused the Korean army and people to the heroic struggle.
					
					 He led the war to victory with his unique strategy and military methods while providing field guidance to several units of the front and the back through a hail of bullets.
					
					 The myth of the U.S. "mightiness" was completely shattered by the President's matchless grit and pluck and outstanding military strategy and tactics in the Korean war.
					
					 At last the U.S. imperialists were compelled to admit their defeat and sign the Armistice Agreement on July 27, 1953.
					
					 Today the DPRK's military power for self defence which was provided by the President and leader Kim Jong Il has been bolstered under the seasoned leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War Observed by Foreigners
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War Observed by Foreigners
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Personages of Nigeria and Denmark released statements on July 19 and 21 to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 M. M. Alhassan, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said:
					
					 We are remembering with deep emotion Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, who defeated two imperialisms in one generation, on the occasion of this year's victory day, July 27.
					
					 Although it was young the DPRK achieved a miraculous victory in the fierce showdown with the imperialist allied forces led by the U.S., which boasted of the strongest military and economic power and longest history of aggression in the world. It was a precious fruition of the outstanding tactics and strategy and original war methods of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Highly praising the Korean people for bringing about the beginning of a downhill turn for U.S. imperialism, Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said:
					
					 The U.S. still keeps holding the signboard of "UN Command" in south Korea, prodding the south Korean army into seeking a chance to provoke a war and invade the DPRK.
					
					 We call for replacing the Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty and dismantling the "UN Command" in the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Congratulates Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Congratulates Raul Castro Ruz
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Friday sent a message to Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba.
					 The message said:
					
					 I, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the heroic attack on the Moncada Barrack which raised a curtain of an armed struggle against the pro-U.S. military dictatorial regime under the command of the dear respected Comrade Fidel Castro, extend warm congratulations and salute to you, the Communist Party of Cuba and the government and people of Cuba.
					
					 Being convinced that the traditional ties of friendship and unity between our two countries would further develop in significant July when the peoples of our two countries fully display their revolutionary will to live independently against imperialism and dominationism, I sincerely wish you greater success in your responsible work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam to Visit Iran
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam to Visit Iran
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, will soon visit Iran to participate in the inaugural ceremony of its president on the invitation of the Iranian government.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Spanish PM
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Spanish PM
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Friday sent a message of sympathy to Spanish Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy Brey as regards a train accident that claimed huge causalities in Spain.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the victims and the bereaved families and hoped that the government of Spain would eradicate the aftermath of the accident as early as possible.

articles.title: DPRK Red Cross Society Delegation Leaves for Hong Kong, China
articles.content:
DPRK Red Cross Society Delegation Leaves for Hong Kong, China
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society led by Deputy Executive Chairman of its Central Committee Paek Yong Ho left here Friday by air to take part in the meeting of leading officials of Red Cross organizations in East Asia to be held in Hong Kong, China.

articles.title: Talks between Delegations of WPK, CPV Held
articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of WPK, CPV Held
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Communist Party of Vietnam (CPV) were held here on Friday.
					 Present at the talks from the WPK side were Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK, and officials of the C.C., WPK and from the CPV side the members of the delegation of the CPV headed by Tran Quoc Vuong, secretary of the Central Committee and head of the Office of the C.C., and Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of activities of their parties and exchanged views on boosting the friendly relations between the two parties and other issues of mutual concern. 
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: E-Library Built in Pyongyang Medical College
articles.content:
E-Library Built in Pyongyang Medical College
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- An e-library has been built in Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University.
					 Leader Kim Jong Il in his lifetime considered the college to be the nation's major center of training medical workers and paid deep attention to the college.
					
					 The five-storied library has its floors decorated with marbles and walls with microlite. 
					
					 With hundreds of computers and hundreds of thousands of books, it can accommodate about 500 people at a time.
					
					 The library houses eight e-reading rooms, tele-education, information and academic exchange rooms and stacks.
					
					 It will greatly help the teachers and students to get a good knowledge of medical science.

articles.title: DPRK, Japanese Teams Tie 0:0
articles.content:
DPRK, Japanese Teams Tie 0:0
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The DPRK female football team tied with its Japanese rival 0:0 in Thursday's match for the 2013 East Asian Cup.
					 The DPRK team beat its south Korean rival 2:1 and met the Japanese team which beat its Chinese rival team 2:0.
					
					 The seesaw battle between the two teams ended in a scoreless draw.
					
					 The DPRK team will play its last match with its Chinese rival on July 27.

articles.title: U.S. Troops Urged to Withdraw from South Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Troops Urged to Withdraw from South Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- There took place a rally in front of the U.S.-south Korea "Combined Forces Command" in Seoul on July 21 in demand of the withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea.
					 The rally was held by the Group for Implementing June 15 Independent National Reunification for Carrying Out Joint Declaration and Concluding a Peace Treaty. It was made up of the South Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy and other public organizations of south Korea.
					
					 The participants termed the "UN Command" nothing but a tool that has been used for the U.S. domination and interference in south Korea and the implementation of its policy of aggression as a servant of the U.S.
					
					 GIs' crimes are on the steady increase and the south Koreans are undergoing misfortunes and sufferings, they noted, deploring that this is an inevitable outcome of the unequal SOFA and the spurious alliance.
					
					 Paragraph 60 of Article 4 of the Armistice Agreement signed on July 27, 1953 calls for the withdrawal of all foreign forces from Korea and peaceful settlement of the Korean issue but the U.S. military presence in south Korea lasted for 60 years under the pretext of south Korea-U.S. "Mutual Defense Treaty."
					
					 Those who seek to keep this alliance with the U.S. regard the U.S. interests as their own, an indication of their subservience, they held.
					
					 They called on the people from all walks of life to dynamically struggle to put an end to the ceasefire and conclude a peace treaty for peace and national reunification, carrying forward the soul of those who fell in actions for independence and reunification.
					
					 They demanded the dismantlement of the "UN Command" and immediate withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Defer Transfer of Right to Control Wartime Operations under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Defer Transfer of OPECON under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Friday released its information bulletin No. 1039 blasting the south Korean authorities for imploring the U.S. to postpone the transfer of the wartime operation control (OPECON).
					 The information bulletin said:
					
					 OPECON was granted by traitor Syngman Rhee to the U.S. during the Korean war. South Korea was supposed to take over the right in 2012 but the Lee Myung Bak group requested Washington to defer the transfer till 2015.
					
					 The present chief executive of south Korea made the takeover of the right her "election" commitment. She clarified her stand that she would take over it in 2015 as scheduled after coming to power. She singled out it as a core task of diplomatic and security policies.
					
					 But, the puppet regime reneged on its commitment in defiance of public demand. It tacitly asked again its American masters to postpone the transfer of the right, talking about "north's nukes" and "security threat".
					
					 As regards the aim sought by the regime in this move, the bulletin went on:
					
					 The puppet conservative group's moves for postponing the transfer of OPECON are dangerous moves to escalate the tension in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia and increase the  danger of a nuclear war against the north. They are pursuant to the U.S. sinister scenario to more effectively use south Korea as an outpost for realizing the U.S. strategy to dominate Asia and hurl the puppet army as a shock brigade for its aggression.
					
					 If the puppet group's attempt to defer the transfer of OPECON comes true, the U.S. will get more desperate in its moves to provoke a war against the DPRK and carry out its strategy for world domination, keeping a firmer grip on south Korea militarily and pursuing its hostile policy towards Pyongyang.
					
					 Its moves more clearly reveal the true colors of the present regime of south Korea as poor colonial servant who regards submission to the U.S. and service to it as a mode of existence and a group of sycophants and traitors hell-bent on dependence on foreign forces and confrontation with fellow countrymen, utterly indifferent to the dignity and interests of the nation.
					
					 Such guys are loudmouthed about an "advanced country", "national status" and "dignity" though they are trying hard to prolong their remaining days dependent on their master, leaving even military sovereignty to the tender mercy of outside forces. It is a political caricature provoking side-splitting laughter.
					
					 South Korea can never shake off its disgrace as a politically underdeveloped region and colony and its people cannot escape misfortune, sufferings and war disaster as long as the pro-U.S. and sycophantic and treacherous group is allowed to ride roughshod, concluded the information bulletin.

articles.title: Japan's Massacre of Koreans during Kapo Peasant War in 1894 Disclosed
articles.content:
Japan's Massacre of Koreans during Kapo Peasant War Disclosed
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- A diary on Japan's massacre of Koreans during the Kapo Peasant War in 1894 was discovered, according to the south Korean paper Hangyore on July 23.
					 An honorary professor at Hokkaido University obtained it from a descendant of a soldier who hailed from Tokushima Prefecture through good offices of a local historian in the spring of last year. 
					
					 The solider belonged to the 2nd squad of the 2nd platoon of the 1st company of the 19th battalion of the then Japanese reservists.
					
					 According to his diary, there were a great many dead bodies in different parts of Raju when his unit reached there.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 After questioning peasant soldiers taken prisoner, Japanese soldiers killed over 10 or even 100 every day. There were altogether 680 dead bodies.
					
					 One day prisoners of war were ordered to stand in a line and bayoneted to death under the command of an officer, shocking every eyewitness.
					
					 Such brutal mass-killings were carried out by the direct orders of the then Japanese prime minister and the diplomatic minister in Korea.
					
					 In order to cover up those crimes the Japanese authorities issued an instruction for deleting the reference to the Korean people's struggle against Japanese invaders from the part dealing with the 1894-1895 Sino-Japanese War of the history textbooks of Japan. And this was supported by the judiciary authorities of Japan.
					
					 In the meantime, the Japanese government described its soldiers killed by peasant troops as those who fell in the battles with the Qing troops and added their names to the mortuary tablet on Yasukuni Shrine.
					
					 Disclosing the diary, the professor said that it contained many words such as "Capture and shoot them to death", "Cruelly torture", "Shoot them all to death," "Set fire to all Koreans' houses," "Burn them to death" and "Torture and shoot them to death and burn their dead bodies." This bears witness to the cruelty of the then army of Japan, professor added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Democratic Congo
						
 Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" was brought out in pamphlet by the Cedi Publishing House of Democratic Congo.
					 The work, a speech made by him at the parade for celebrating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung on April 15, Juche 101 (2012), says the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proves the immutable truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of the country and the nation.
					
					 It sets forth the tasks to be fulfilled to demonstrate the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully carry out the cause of building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 A releasing ceremony of the work was held in Kinshasa on July 18.

articles.title: Acto central por 60o aniversario de victoria en Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria
articles.content:
Acto central por 60o aniversario de victoria en Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria
Pyongyang, 26 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar  el dia 26 en el capitalino Estadio Primero de Mayo el solemne acto central por el 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					Aparecio en la tribuna el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Tambien tomaron asiento de la tribuna Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae y otros cuadros directivos del Partido, el Estado y el ejercito, Kim Yong Dae, presidente del Comite Central del Partido Social-Democrata y los funcionarios del partido y las fuerzas armadas.
					
					Y aparecieron en la tribuna Li Yuanchao, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y vicepresidente de la RPCh, Abdullah al－Ahmar, subsecretario general del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe (BAAS), Guy Scott vicepresidente de la Republica de Zambia, Edward Kiwanuka Ssekand vicepresidente de la Republica de Uganda presidida y otros jefes de las delegaciones de varios paises.
					
					Ademas se ven en la tribuna Hong In Hum, presidente de la comision central de revision de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon), Choe Un Bok, presidenta de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en China y Kim Kang Hui, jefe del grupo de conferenciantes de los veteranos del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino. de Corea, los delegados de los veteranos de guerra, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el poder, entidades sociales, ministerios y organos centrales, familias de martires, oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y el Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los funcionarios de las instituciones de ciencia, educacion, literatura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion, benemeritos, trabajadores capitalinos, compatriotas en ultramar y sus delegaciones y el representante de la sucursal del Frente Democratico Nacional Antiimperialista en Pyongyang.
					
					Fueron invitados los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises y de organizaciones internacionales y los miembros del Cuerpo de Agregados Militares, acreditados en Corea, delegaciones y delegados de diversos paises y huespedes extranjeros de visita en Corea para participar en las festividades por el 60o aniversario de la victoria en la pasada guerra coreana.
					
					El vicemariscal Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, declaro la apertura del acto.
					
					El informe de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, quien senalo en particular:
					
					El imperialismo norteamericano provoco el 25 de junio de 1950 la guerra coreana con el objetivo de realizar la ambicion de apoderarse de la heguemonia en Asia y el resto del mundo tomando como trampolin la Peninsula Coreana. Para este fin abuso del rotulo de la ONU para movilizar hasta los ejercitos de paises satelites y se valio de todos los metodos y medios mas barbaros inclusive el chantaje de bomba nuclear.
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC vencieron a los invasores armados de 16 paises inclusive Estados Unidos y los titeres del Sur de Corea.
					
					La historica victoria en la pasada guerra coreana fue el triunfo de la autoctona idea militar, la estrategia y tacticas destacadas del Presidente Kim Il Sung y de las indoblegables fuerzas espirituales del ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC quienes lucharon heroicamente unidos compactamente en torno al partido y el lider.
					
					Durante la guerra de 3 anos, el imperialismo norteamericano sufrio una derrota amarga nunca vista en la historia de guerra de agresion de mas de 100 anos y firmo el acta de capitulacion; la RPDC se hizo pais heroico y su ejercito y pueblo llegaron a glorificar como ejercito y pueblo heroicos en escala mundial.
					
					En la pasada guerra coreana, el partido y el gobierno de China enviaron el ejercito de voluntarios organizado con sus excelentes hijos e hijas bajo la bandera de resistir a los yanquis, ayudar a Corea y defender el hogar y el pais propios y ayudaron con sangre a la justa lucha del pueblo coreano aun en medio de las condiciones dificiles por haber conquistado poco antes la victoria en la revolucion popular.
					
					El modelo internacional demostrado por el Ejercito de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino en la  guerra coreana  fue registrado con las letras doradas en la pagina de la historia de amistad Corea-China y nuestro partido y pueblo no lo olvidaran para siempre.
					
					Bajo la sabia direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un el ejercito y pueblo de la RPDC han acogido la nueva era de la historia que permite continuar con brillantez la invicta historia y tradiciones iniciadas en el monte Paektu y conduce  fidedignamente la causa de la independencia de la humanidad.
					
					Debemos  enaltecer de generacion en generacion a los grandes Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il  como  eterno lider de nuestro partido y pueblo y como sol del Juche, defender con firmeza sus proezas de victoria en guerra y de revolucion del Songun y  glorificarlas para siempre.
					
					 Nuestro ejercito y pueblo seguiran luchando por la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana, el Nordeste Asiatico y el resto del mundo junto con los pueblos progresistas que aspiran a la justicia y aprecian la conciencia.
					
					Al contar con tales proezas de los Generalisimos, el invencible ejercito revolucionario del monte Paektu que goza de la sabia direccion del Mariscal, ante nosotros habra solo el victorioso dia de 27 de julio.
					
					El mismo dia, semejantes actos se desarrollaron tambien en todas las provincias, ciudades (municipios), distritos y complejos.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe a delegacion de RPCh
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe a delegacion de RPCh
						
Pyongyang, 26 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se reunio el dia 25 con la delegacion de la Republica Popular China encabezada por Li Yuanchao, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y vicepresidente de la RPCh, que realiza una visita a la RPDC para participar en las festividades del 60o aniversario del triunfo del pueblo coreano en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los integrantes de la delegacion como el viceministro ejecutivo de Relaciones Exteriores Zhang Yesui, el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Jia Tingan, el subjefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del Comite Central del PCCh Chen Fengxiang, el vicegobernador de la provincia de Liaoning Bing Zhigang, el vicegobernador de la provincia de Jilin Chen Weigen y el embajador chino en Corea Liu Hongcai.
					
					Participo tambien el primer vicecanciller Kim Kye Gwan.
					
					Luego de intercambiar saludos con los huespedes chinos, el Mariscal departio con ellos.
					
					En la ocasion, Li Yuanchao le traslado el saludo cordial y mensaje oral de parte del Secretario General del CC del PCCh y Presidente de la RPCh, Xi Jinping.
					
					Expresando agradecimiento al Mariscal por haber recibido a la delegacion a pesar de estar muy ocupado por dirigir al frente la lucha por construir un Estado prospero, felicito calidamente al pueblo coreano por el significativo dia 27 de Julio en representacion del partido y el gobierno de China.
					
					Dijo que visito a Corea con la mision de defender y hacer brillar de generacion en generacion la amistad combativa entre los ejercitos y pueblos de los dos paises establecida con sangre.
					
					Destaco que el partido y el gobierno de China estan contentos de los grandes exitos que alcanza el pueblo coreano en la lucha por construir un Estado prospero socialista en pleno acato al legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il bajo la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					China y Corea son vecinos amistosos y consolidar y desarrollar constantemente las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion China-Corea son la orientacion invariable del partido y el gobierno de China, ratifico.
					
					Continuo que el partido y el gobierno de China aprecian mucho las relaciones de amistad China-Corea preparadas y desarrolladas por los lideres de dos partidos y dos paises de la generacion veterana.
					
					Aseguro que el nuevo colectivo de direccion central del PCCh realizara el intercambio y la cooperacion de caracter amistoso respetando y confiando mutuamente con el partido y gobierno coreanos con vistas a fomentar el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre China y Corea.
					
					Tras dar calida bienvenida a la delegacion china, el Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio un saludo cordial al colectivo de direccion central del PCCh encabezado por su Secretario General Xi Jinping y al pueblo chino.
					
					Expreso agradecimiento al partido y el gobierno de China por haber enviado la delegacion de la RPCh a los actos festivos del 60o aniversario de la victoria en guerra.
					
					Apunto que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea no olvidaran nunca el desinteresado apoyo internacionalista del partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de China brindado al pueblo coreano durante la pasada guerra coreana y los meritos de los valientes soldados del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino participantes en la misma guerra.
					
					Consolidar y desarrollar mas de generacion en generacion la tradicional amistad Corea-China es la inconmovible voluntad del PTC y el pueblo coreano, dijo y expreso la conviccion de que la inagotable vitalidad de amistad Corea-China, patrimonio comun de los dos pueblos, se pondra de pleno manifiesto en el futuro gracias a los esfuerzos conjuntos de ambas partes.
					
					Intercambio con los huespedes chinos los criterios sobre el problema de fortalecer y desarrollar las relaciones entre los dos paises y el de garantizar la paz y seguridad del Nordeste Asiatico y el resto del mundo y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en una atmosfera amistosa y cordial.
					
					Li Yuanchao dedico a Kim Jong Un regalo preparado con mucha sinceridad.
					
					Al expresar agradecimiento por el respecto, el Mariscal se fotografio junto con todos los integrantes de la delegacion y los miembros de la embajada china en Corea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se reune con jefes de delegaciones extranjeras de visita en Corea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se reune con jefes de delegaciones extranjeras de visita en Corea
						
Pyongyang, 26 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea se reunio el dia 26 con los jefes de las delegaciones de varios paises de visita en Corea para participar en las festividades por el 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Li Yuanchao, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y vicepresidente de la Republica Popular China; Abdullah al－Ahmar, subsecretario general del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe (BAAS); Edward Kiwanuka Ssekand, vicepresidente de la Republica de Uganda; Guy Scout, vicepresidente de la Republica de Zambia; Marie-Madeleine Mienze, subsecretario general del Partido Popular por la Reconstruccion y la Democracia del Congo Democratico; Manuel Francisco Tuta, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Movimiento Popular de Liberacion de Angola; Paolo Romani, vicepresidente del Grupo de la Libertad Popular en el Senado de Italia; Jose Ramon Balaguer, jefe de Departamento Internacional del CC del Partido Comunista de Cuba; Tran Quoc Vuong, secretario del CC del Partido Comunista de Vietnam; Cheuang Sombounkhan, secretario del CC del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao;  Yu Zhenwu, ex comandante de las fuerzas aereas del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China; Sayed Hamidreza Tabatabaei, subcomandante en jefe del ejercito irani; Luong Cong, subdirector de departamento politico general del Ejercito Popular de Vietnam; Ya. V. Kanov, vicepresidente de consejo ruso de veteranos de guerra coreana; Li Xiubao, subjefe de Seccion de Publicidad de departamento politico general del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China; Avirmed Battor, viceministro de Defensa de Mongolia; Agostinho Salvador Mondlane, viceministro de Defensa Nacional de Mozambique y Odongo Jeje, ministro de Estado para el Ministerio de Defensa de Uganda.
					
					Asistieron tambien Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Kyok Sik, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Kyong Hui y Kim Ki Nam.
					
					Los huespedes, tras felicitar calurosamente el 60o aniversario de la victoria en la pasada guerra, desearon al Mariscal Kim Jong Un buena salud y mayores exitos en su labor.
					
					El Mariscal expreso agradecimiento por el respecto.
					
					Al dar bienvenida a los huespedes de varios paises, de visita en Corea para participar en las festividades por el 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra, el Mariscal deseo que los visitantes pasen los dias tranquilos y alegres.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz
						
Pyongyang, 26 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, envio este viernes un mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y Presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba.
					El texto va como sigue:
					
					Con motivo del 60o aniversario del heroico asalto al Cuartel Moncada, que dio inicio a la lucha armada contra el poder dictatorial militar pronorteamericano bajo el mando del estimado camarada Fidel Castro, quisiera extender a Vd., el Partido Comunista de Cuba, el gobierno y pueblo de la Republica de Cuba las calurosas felicitaciones y el saludo combativo. 
					
					Convencido de que en julio significativo en que se manifiesta plenamente la voluntad revolucionaria de los pueblos de nuestros dos paises de oponernos al imperialismo y la hegemonia y vivir de manera independiente, se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas los tradicionales lazos de amistad y solidaridad entre nuestros dos paises, le deseo de todo corazon a Vd mayores exitos en su trabajo responsable.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de Siria
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de Siria
						
Pyongyang, 26 de julio (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio el dia 26 en un ambiente amistoso en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de la Republica Arabe de Siria presidida por Abdullah al－Ahmar, subsecretario general del Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe (BAAS), quien le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Encargado de negocios a. i. de Siria ofrece banquete por 27 de Julio
articles.content:
Encargado de negocios a. i. de Siria ofrece banquete por 27 de Julio
						
Pyongyang, 26 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 60o aniversario de la victoria del pueblo coreano en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, el encargado de negocios a. i. de Siria en Corea, Haissam Saad, ofrecio la vispera un banquete en su sede diplomatica.
